instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2523: What is 820-2523? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4L: What is PM_SLP_S4L? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4L, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
So the issue started with slow charge.
pin 17/18 and 27/28 checked out so i decided to replace the isl but now i only get a green light no charge indication.

i checked the smc data line resistors and theyre fine

the board will run off the battery and charger but will shut off if the charger is plugged in and battery is removed.

also i can see the magsafes green light will start to flicker when the battery is plugged in.

also <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> (i cant remember exact component number) the current sensing component for charge fluctuates between 11.7 to 11.9v on pad 5.

could this be a case of bad isl from donor board?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: Original issue is <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR>. Replace ISL again.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: replaced isl now im not getting <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4L</SIGNAL> board will not turn on.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: I cannot see over the internet what you have broken....Is PPBUS still present?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: And what does a low PPBUS voltage like that mean?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: ok got the machine working again but it wont charge. charger light slightly pulses while connected. 17/18 - 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> are giving proper readings.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: What is PPBUS then without a battery?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: 8.19v without and pulsing 11-11.20v with battery connected

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: Did you replace the ISL with a 6258? This is not a 6259! If that is correct check voltages at <TRANSISTOR>Q7065</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: Switched out the isl for a 6258 now its back to charging normally!
